course_title: Air Quality in the Urban Environment: A Survey of Research Methods and Recent Findings
course_description: The link between the air we breathe and human health affects millions globally, placing urban air quality as a leading contributor to the global burden of disease. This course examines ways to characterize urban air pollution as well as its public health implications based on recent clinical, epidemiological, and toxicological research. The course will be highly interactive and will provide instruction on conducting basic, applied air quality research in academic, governmental, and grassroots settings.
sections: Class Nbr: 4507, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: T 10:15a-12:05p, Instructor: Liang/Shi, Status: Open
